sentence.Network_en: The existentialist does not believe in the power of passion.
sentence.Network_cn: 存在主义者不相信激情的力量.

sentence.Network_en: The existentialist thinks it very distressing that God does not exist.
sentence.Network_cn: 存在主义者认为这是非常苦恼的,即上帝不存在.

sentence.Network_en: To an old fashioned existentialist, that's all that counts.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于一个守旧的存在主义者来说, 这一切是至关重要的.

list.abs: He holds existentialist views ., 他持存在主义观点.
...存在主义法学编辑存在主义法学(existentialist jurisprudence)，以存在主义哲学为其理沦基础，并带有新康德主义法学，自然法学和实证法学的观点来研究法学的当代西方法理学分支学科，存在主义哲学以强调(自我)存在，(自我)价值的非理性主义为特征，而存在.
...存在主义伦理学编辑目录1简介2基本观点1简介存在主义伦理学(existentialist ethics)，当代西方一种非道德主义的伦理学.
inspiration to us from existentialist education ., 存在主义教育观给我们的启示.

entry.def: An existentialist is a person who agrees with the philosophy of existentialism.
If you describe a person or their philosophy as existentialist, you mean that their beliefs are based on existentialism.

means.word_mean: 1. a philosopher who emphasizes freedom of choice and personal responsibility but who regards human existence in a hostile universe as unexplainable

auth_sentence.content: The only person hung up on metaphysical existentialist questions.
auth_sentence.res_content: The only person hung up on metaphysical existentialist questions.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The only person hung up on metaphysical existentialist questions.

auth_sentence.content: The dance critic Jill Johnston called him a cheerful existentialist.

auth_sentence.content: For an existentialist, existence precedes essence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For an existentialist, existence precedes essence.
